comments.html: Hahaha!  Sadly, this does not only apply to developers.  In this day and age, our industry is inundated with people who do infinitely more blogging/talking than actual technical work.
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html: I think I might have a reverse case here. I'm never 100% sure about anything. Even about solutions I've deployed yesterday.
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html: The "Expert Beginner" seems to be, at the core, someone who lacks introspection. I'll bet that Introverts are the least likely of all to become an Expert Beginner.
comments.name: Brad Hedlund

comments.html: Not sure I agree with that. I would use "armchair expert" for someone who has no hands-on experience, whereas Expert Beginners have plenty of hands-on experience, but no depth of knowledge/understanding.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: There's another nickname for such specimens - armchair experts ;)
comments.name: Mitko

comments.html: "The trouble with this world is that the idiots are so sure of themselves and the sensible so full of doubts." ~~Bertrand Russell
comments.name: Jimmy Hess
